pycantus.models package

Submodules

pycantus.models.chant module

This module contains the Chant class, which represents a single chant entry from some database. It provides methods for creating, modifying, and exporting chant data in a standardized format.

class pycantus.models.chant.Chant(cantus_id: str, incipit: str, siglum: str, srclink: str, chantlink: str, folio: str, db: str, sequence=None, feast=None, genre=None, office=None, position=None, melody_id=None, image=None, mode=None, full_text=None, melody=None, century=None, rite=None)

Bases: object

Represents one chant entry (record of chant occurrence) in database.

siglum

* Abbreviation for the source manuscript or collection (e.g., “A-ABC Fragm. 1”). Use RISM whenever possible.

Type:

str

srclink

* URL link to the source in the external database (e.g., “https://yourdatabase.org/source/123”).

Type:

str

chantlink

* URL link directly to the chant entry in the external database (e.g., “https://yourdatabase.org/chant/45678”).

Type:

str

folio

* Folio information for the chant (e.g., “001v”).

Type:

str

sequence

The order of the chant on the folio (e.g., “1”).

Type:

str

incipit

* The opening words or phrase of the chant (e.g., “Non sufficiens sibi semel aspexisse vis “).

Type:

str

feast

Feast or liturgical occasion associated with the chant (e.g., “Nativitas Mariae”).

Type:

str

genre

Genre of the chant, such as antiphon (A), responsory (R), hymn (H), etc. (e.g., “V”).

Type:

str

office

The office in which the chant is used, such as Matins (M) or Lauds (L) (e.g., “M”).

Type:

str

position

Liturgical position of the chant in the office (e.g., “01”).

Type:

str

cantus_id

* The unique Cantus ID associated with the chant (e.g., “007129a”).

Type:

str

melody_id

The unique Melody ID associated with the chant (e.g., “001216m1”).

Type:

str

image

URL link to an image of the manuscript page, if available (e.g., “https://yourdatabase.org/image/12345”).

Type:

str

mode

Mode of the chant, if available (e.g., “1”).

Type:

str

full_text

Full text of the chant (e.g., “Non sufficiens sibi semel aspexisse vis amoris multiplicavit in ea inten]tionem inquisitionis”).

Type:

str

melody

Melody encoded in volpiano, if available (e.g., “1—dH—h7–h–ghgfed–gH—h–h—“).

Type:

str

century

Number identifying the century of the source. If multiple centuries apply, the lowest number should be used. (e.g., “12”).

Type:

str

db

* Code for the database providing the data, used for identification within CI (e.g., “DBcode”).

Type:

str

rite

(not yet in CI, but possibly to be (so we want to be ready), not in export)

Type:

str

locked

Indicates whether the object is locked for editing. If True, no attributes can be modified. (functional attribute)

Type:

bool

_has_melody

True if the chant has a melody, False otherwise. (functional attribute)

Type:

bool

melody_object

If the chant has a melody, this should be an instance of the Melody class representing the chant’s melody once created. (functional attribute)

Type:

Melody

(Fields marked with an asterisk (*) are obligatory and must be included in every record. Other fields are optional but recommended when data is available.)

create_melody()

Creates a Melody object for the chant if it has a melody. Expects volpiano to be provided.

static header() → str

Constructs proper csv header of chants, e.g. for export.

Returns:

the header for the CSV file, which includes all mandatory and optional fields.

Return type:

str

property is_complete_chant: bool

Checks if the chant has complete melodic and textual data. Conditions for being a complete chant: - Has a melody - The melody’s volpiano is a valid string containing notes - Has full text - The full text is not identical to the incipit - The volpiano starts with ‘1’ (indicating G clef) - The volpiano does not contain ‘2’ (indicating F clef) - The volpiano does not contain ‘6——6’ (indicating missing pitches) - The volpiano contains only valid characters - The volpiano contains at least one word boundary (’—‘)

property to_csv_row: str

Returns data fields of Chant in “to be pasted to the csv export file” form.

Returns:

data of object as standardized csv row

Return type:

str

pycantus.models.chant.get_rite_dict() → dict[str]

Loads data about rites of genres.

Returns:

{genre : rite}

Return type:

dict

pycantus.models.corpus module

This module contains the Corpus class, which represents a collection of chants and sources. It provides methods for loading, filtering, and exporting data related to the chants and sources.

class pycantus.models.corpus.Corpus(chants_filepath, sources_filepath=None, chants_fallback_url=None, sources_fallback_url=None, other_parameters=None, is_editable=False, check_missing_sources=False, create_missing_sources=False, **kwargs)

Bases: object

Represents a collection of chants and sources (piece of repertoire).

chants_filepath

path to file with chants

Type:

str

sources_filepath

path to file with sources

Type:

str, optional

chants_fallback_url

URL for chants file download, is used when loading from filepath fails

Type:

str, optional

sources_fallback_url

URL for sources file download, is used when loading from filepath fails

Type:

str, optional

other_download_parameters

[not used yet]

Type:

dict, optional

is_editable

indicates whether objects in Corpus should be locked

Type:

bool

check_missing_sources

indicates whether load should an raise exception if some chant refers to source that is not in sources

Type:

bool

create_missing_sources

indicates whether load should create Source entries for sources referred to in some of the chants and not being present in provided sources

Type:

bool

operations_history

list of operations applied on the corpus (from predefined list - see methods with @log_operation decorator)

Type:

list

_chants

list of Chant objects in the corpus

Type:

list

_sources

list of Source objects in the corpus

Type:

list

Only chants_filepath is mandatory. The only way to initialize Corpus is via load from CSV files, it is not possible from chants and sources lists. That is due to the “good replicability practice” we wanted to emphasize.

apply_filter(filter: Filter)

Applies the given filter on stored data in “in place” way. Stores filter setting into filtration_history.

Parameters:

filter (Filter) – filter to be applied

Note

In future we plan to add clone_and_apply_filter(filter) method as well.

property chants
property csv_chants_header: str

Returns proper csv header for chants export to csv. :returns: csv header for Chant :rtype: str

property csv_sources_header: str

Returns proper csv header for sources export to csv. :returns: csv header for Source :rtype: str

drop_duplicate_chants()

Discards all chants that have the same chantlink as another chant.

Keeps the last occurrence of each chant.

drop_duplicate_sources()

Discards all sources that have the same srclink as another source.

Keeps the last occurrence of each source.

drop_empty_sources()

Discards all sources that have no chants in corpus.

drop_incomplete_chants()

Discards all chants that do not have complete melodic and textual data.

drop_small_sources_data(min_chants: int)

Discards all sources that have less than min_chants chants in corpus and discard their chants as well.

Parameters:

min_chants (int) – minimum number of chants a source must have to be kept

export_csv(chants_filepath: str, sources_filepath=None)

Exports the chants and sources to CSV files.

If sources_filepath is not provided or sources are not in Corpus, only chants will be exported.

Parameters:

  • chants_filepath (str) – Path to the output CSV file for chants.

  • sources_filepath (str) – Path to the output CSV file for sources. (optional)

get_operations_history_string()

Returns the history of applied operations on the corpus.

keep_melodic_chants()

Keeps only chants that have a melody in the corpus.

property melody_objects: list[Melody]

Collects melody_objects of Chants in self._chants . :returns: melody objects of chants in the Corpus :rtype: list

property sources

pycantus.models.melody module

This module contains the Melody class, which represents a single chant melody.

It is linked to a specific chant via chantlink.

Right now, it is designed in volpiano-centric way, meaning it holds only the volpiano representation of the chant melody, if present. But it can be extended to hold other representations in the future (via new optional parameters).

We take the volpiano.utils as already prepared methods (functions) for working with volpiano and just wrapped them into Melody class methods. For more detailed documentation of the methods, see the volpiano.utils module.

class pycantus.models.melody.Melody(volpiano: str, chantlink: str, cantus_id: str, mode: str)

Bases: object

Representation of one chant melody related to chant record. .. attribute:: volpiano

The melody encoded in volpiano notation.

type:

str

chantlink

URL link directly to the chant entry in the external database.

Type:

str

cantus_id

The Cantus ID associated with the chant.

Type:

str

raw_volpiano

The original volpiano string before any processing.

Type:

str

mode

Mode of the melody (e.g., “1”).

Type:

str

locked

Indicates if the object is locked for editing. (functional attribute)

Type:

bool

clean_volpiano(keep_boundaries=False, allowed_chars=None, neume_boundary=' ', syllable_boundary=' ', word_boundary=' ', keep_bars=False, allowed_bars='345', bar='|')

Extracts only the allowed characters (and optionally boundaries) from a volpiano string.

Edits the self.volpiano attribute.

discard_differentia(text: str = None)

Determines whether the given volpiano melody ends with a differentia or not and if yes, strips it away.

expand_accidentals(omit_notes=False, barlines='3456', apply_once_only=False)

Expand all accidentals in a volpiano string by adding the accidental to all other notes in the scope.

Edits the self.volpiano attribute.

get_range() → tuple[int]

Computes the range of the melody with respect to the last note: how many steps below and above this last note does the melody reach?

Does NOT work with liquescents.

Returns:

the range of the melody with respect to the last note

Return type:

tuple

normalize_liquescents()

Treat all liquescences as normal notes.

normalize_volpiano(keep_boundaries=False, allowed_chars=None, neume_boundary=' ', syllable_boundary=' ', word_boundary=' ', keep_bars=False, allowed_bars='345', bar='|')

Wrapper for standard volpiano normalization steps. Normalizes a volpiano string by removing differentiae, normalizing liquescents and cleaning the string to only contain allowed characters.

Edits the self.volpiano attribute.

pycantus.models.source module

This module contains Source class, which represents a single source entry from some database. It provides methods for creating, modifying, and exporting source data in a standardized format.

class pycantus.models.source.Source(title, srclink, siglum, numeric_century=None, century=None, provenance=None, cursus=None)

Bases: object

Represents one source entry in database.

str

Type:
